Miscellanea¶

pydu.unix_timeout(seconds)¶

This func decorates any func which may be hang for a while. The param seconds should be integer. unix_timeout can only be used on unix-like system. In test.py, you may write like below:

import time
from pydu.misc import unix_timeout
@unix_timeout(1)
def f():
    time.sleep(1.01)
f()

Ant run test.py, will see TimeoutError.

pydu.trace(obj)¶

Tracing every statement and line number for running program, like bash -x. In test.py, you may write like below:

from pydu import trace
@trace
def f():
    print(1)
    a = 1 + 5
    b = [a]
    print(2)
f()

Ant run test.py, will see below output from console:

test.py(4):     print(1)
1
test.py(5):     a = 1 + 5
test.py(6):     b = [a]
test.py(7):     print(2)
2
